original: BRISMAN, Sven Bernhard, Professor, Stockholm, f Kil 9/6 81 av postm D B o Julia Hegardt, gm Ester Carlberg. Studex Gbg latin 99, fil kand 03, fil lic 07, disp 08, fil dr 09 (samtl v GbHS). Doc v GbHS 09, lär v Gbgs h samsk 08—10, doc v HHS 10, prof där 17 i nat.ekon o bkvetensk (A O Wallenbergs prof). Innehaft fi sakk- o komm.uppdr, föreläst hdlskamm o näringsorg (Sv bkfrn, Ind.-frb, Exp.frn, Köpm.kl, Försäkr.frn). Styr.led Sv försäkr.frn 25—32, d:o Nat.ekon frn 28— 35, v. ordf 32—33, ordf 34—35. Resor: Engl o Skotl 06, 12, 23, Tyskl 12, 14, de Skand länd uppr ggr. Av trycket: Realisationsfrågan 1808—1834 (grad.avh 08), Vårt ekon o soc liv (11), De mod aff.bka (15), Nat.ekonomi (16), Sv riksbk 1668—1918, del I (18), del IV (31), AB Gbgs bk (mskr, 23), Hur en nat-ekonom betraktar världen (24), Sv aff.bkr. Grundläggn.tiden (24), Utveckl.tiden (34), Nät.ekonomiens grunder (26, 5. uppl 41, Ögl ensk bk 1837—1937 (37), ett st ant upps o art i tidskr o tidn. Hobbies: Golf (medl Sthlms golfkl, fd Styr.led o sekr där samt ordf dess tävl.komm, skriv om golf i Sv Dagbl samt i eng o amer tidskr); atomfysik, astronomi, geologi o psykologi ss förströelseläsning.
translated: BRISMAN, Sven Bernhard, Professor, Stockholm, b. Kil 9/6 1881, son of postman D B and Julia Hegardt, m. Ester Carlberg. Studied at Gothenburg Latin School in 1899, graduated with a Bachelor of Arts in 1903, obtained a Master's degree in 1907, defended a dissertation in 1908, and received a doctoral degree in 1909 (all from Gothenburg Higher School). Became a lecturer at Gothenburg High School for Social Sciences from 1908 to 1910, became a docent at Gothenburg Higher School in 1909, and became a professor of national economics and accounting at Gothenburg Higher School in 1917 (A O Wallenberg's professorship). Held various expert and committee assignments, lectured for trade chambers and business organizations (Swedish Bookkeeping Association, Industrial Association, Export Association, Merchants' Club, Insurance Association). Served on the board of directors of the Swedish Insurance Company from 1925 to 1932, the National Economy Association from 1928 to 1935, served as vice chairman from 1932 to 1933, and chairman from 1934 to 1935. Traveled to England and Scotland in 1906, 1912, and 1923, Germany in 1912 and 1914, and several Scandinavian countries multiple times. Publications include: "The Question of Realization 1808-1834" (doctoral dissertation, 1908), "Our Economic and Social Life" (1911), "Modes of Business Transactions" (1915), "Economics" (1916), "The Swedish National Bank 1668-1918, Vol. I" (1918) and Vol. IV (1931), "AB Gothenburg Bank" (manuscript, 1923), "How an Economist Views the World" (1924), "Swedish Business Books. Founding Period" (1924), "Development Period" (1934), "Foundations of National Economics" (1926, 5th edition 1941), "The History of English Banking 1837-1937" (1937), and numerous articles in journals and newspapers. Hobbies: Golf (member of Stockholm Golf Club, former board member and secretary, as well as chairman of its tournament committee, writes about golf in Svenska Dagbladet and in English and American journals); enjoys reading about atomic physics, astronomy, geology, and psychology.
